description: Latin repatriare, from re- + patria (“homeland”). Cognate to repair (“to return”).

entries.meaning: A person who has returned to their country of origin or whose original citizenship has been restored.

verbs.description: repatriate (third-person singular simple present repatriates, present participle repatriating, simple past and past participle repatriated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To restore (a person) to their own country.
(transitive) To return (artworks, museum exhibits, etc.) to their country of origin.
(transitive) To convert a foreign currency into the currency of one's own country.
